what: Tools for Analyzing Extension Packages in the Grammar of Graphics Ecosystem
title: Tools for Analyzing Extension Packages in the Grammar of Graphics Ecosystem
text: Tools analyzing ggplot2-related extension packages CRAN GitHub. might useful cases well. Function writing leaned heavily AI (ChatGPT 5.2). formal testing. Use risk.

what: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
text: Constructs data frame mapping package names earliest known appearance CRAN archive, inferred file modification times.

title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
text: cran_archive_db Optional result tools::CRAN_archive_db(). supplied, retrieved internally.

title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
text: data frame columns: package – package name archive_date – earliest archive date (Date) NA

title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df
text: CRAN archive database named list data frames, one per package. package, earliest file mtime used proxy archive entry date. Packages empty archive entries return NA. function intended called result reused efficient per-package lookups.

title: Build a lookup table of CRAN archive first appearance dates — build_archive_df

what: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
text: Parses character string (typically derived CRAN URL /BugReports fields) extracts first GitHub user/repository pair finds.

title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
text: url_text single character string containing one URLs free-form text may include GitHub repository link.

title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
text: one-row data frame two character columns: github_user GitHub account name, NA_character_ found github_repo GitHub repository name, NA_character_ found

title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
text: function looks URLs form: github.com/<user>/<repo> (optionally ending .git). GitHub repository can identified, one-row data frame NA values returned. function always returns data frame, making safe use purrr::map() followed purrr::list_rbind().

title: Extract GitHub user and repository from text — extract_github_repo
code: extract_github_repo("https://github.com/tidyverse/ggplot2") #>   github_user github_repo #> 1   tidyverse     ggplot2  extract_github_repo("Bug reports at https://github.com/r-lib/vctrs/issues") #>   github_user github_repo #> 1       r-lib       vctrs  extract_github_repo(NA_character_) #>   github_user github_repo #> 1        <NA>        <NA>

what: Extract ggplot2-extension components from a CRAN package — get_components_cran
title: Extract ggplot2-extension components from a CRAN package — get_components_cran
text: Downloads CRAN source tarball pkg_name (unless cached), extracts package NAMESPACE, calls analyze_pkg_source() identify exported ggplot2 “grammar” components (e.g., functions named like geom_*, stat_*, scale_*, etc., depending analyze_pkg_source() detects).

title: Extract ggplot2-extension components from a CRAN package — get_components_cran
Extract ggplot2-extension components from a CRAN package — get_components_cran
text: pkg_name Character scalar. CRAN package name. cran_db Optional CRAN package database returned tools::CRAN_package_db(). NULL, computed demand. cache_root Character scalar. Root directory used -disk caching extracted NAMESPACE files. Default "~/CRAN".

title: Extract ggplot2-extension components from a CRAN package — get_components_cran
text: data.frame columns: package Package name. component Component type/category identified analyze_pkg_source(). fname Function name. package found CRAN, downloaded, NAMESPACE extracted, returns empty data frame columns.

title: Extract ggplot2-extension components from a CRAN package — get_components_cran
text: function caches NAMESPACE file cache_root/<pkg>/<version>/NAMESPACE keeps directory “clean” removing files might present. Network access required first run given package version. cache keyed package version cran_db, updates CRAN cached separately. function assumes analyze_pkg_source(pkg_name, cache_dir) exists can operate given directory contains (minimum) NAMESPACE file.

title: Extract ggplot2-extension components from a CRAN package — get_components_cran
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Using a precomputed CRAN DB speeds up repeated calls db <- tools::CRAN_package_db() out <- get_components_cran("ggrepel", cran_db = db, cache_root = tempdir()) head(out)  # Use the default cache under ~/CRAN out2 <- get_components_cran("ggridges") } # }

what: Extract ggplot2 grammar components from a GitHub repository — get_components_github
title: Extract ggplot2 grammar components from a GitHub repository — get_components_github
text: Extract ggplot2 grammar components GitHub repository

title: Extract ggplot2 grammar components from a GitHub repository — get_components_github
Extract ggplot2 grammar components from a GitHub repository — get_components_github
text: pkg_name Package name repo_url GitHub repository URL (optionally including /tree/branch/path)

title: Extract ggplot2 grammar components from a GitHub repository — get_components_github
text: data.frame package, component, function names

what: Get “first seen” dates for a symbol across GitHub + CRAN — get_first_all
title: Get “first seen” dates for a symbol across GitHub + CRAN — get_first_all
text: Computes small one-row summary earliest known dates across: first commit repo (file), first commit mentioning/introducing fname (per get_first_commit() logic), first GitHub release/export date fname (per get_first_export_github()), first CRAN release date package (via get_first_release()), first CRAN version explicitly exports fname (via get_first_export_cran()).

title: Get “first seen” dates for a symbol across GitHub + CRAN — get_first_all
code: get_first_all(user, repo, fname, cran_db = NULL, archive_df = NULL)

title: Get “first seen” dates for a symbol across GitHub + CRAN — get_first_all
text: user Character scalar. GitHub owner/user (e.g. "tidyverse"). repo Character scalar. GitHub repo name (assumed CRAN package name). fname Character scalar. Symbol look (e.g. "pivot_longer"). cran_db Optional data.frame returned tools::CRAN_package_db(). NULL, retrieved internally. archive_df Optional archive lookup data.frame columns package archive_date, typically build_archive_df(). NULL, retrieved internally.

title: Get “first seen” dates for a symbol across GitHub + CRAN — get_first_all
text: one-row data.frame columns: first_repo Earliest commit date repository (Date NA). first_commit Earliest commit date returned get_first_commit() fname (Date NA). first_gh Earliest GitHub export/release date fname per get_first_export_github() (Date NA). first_release Earliest CRAN release date package per get_first_release() (Date NA). first_cran Earliest CRAN export date fname per get_first_export_cran() (Date NA).

title: Get “first seen” dates for a symbol across GitHub + CRAN — get_first_all
text: returned values Date scalars (NA) function returns one-row data.frame. function assumes CRAN package name matches repo. ’s always true workflow, add separate pkg argument pass get_first_release() get_first_export_cran().

title: Get “first seen” dates for a symbol across GitHub + CRAN — get_first_all

what: Find the first commit where a function is called in a GitHub repo — get_first_call_github
title: Find the first commit where a function is called in a GitHub repo — get_first_call_github
text: Clones GitHub repository local cache directory (already present), checks target ref (branch default), scans commits (oldest newest) whose diffs dir match call-like pattern fname (e.g. foo( pkg::foo(). candidate commit, verifies call present somewhere repository tree commit using git grep.

title: Find the first commit where a function is called in a GitHub repo — get_first_call_github
code: get_first_call_github(   owner,   repo,   fname = "ggplot",   date_only = FALSE,   branch = NULL,   max_commits = Inf,   cache_dir = getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "gh_repo_cache")),   dir = "R" )

title: Find the first commit where a function is called in a GitHub repo — get_first_call_github
text: owner Character scalar. GitHub username organization. repo Character scalar. GitHub repository name. fname Character scalar. Symbol search (e.g. "ggplot"). date_only Logical; TRUE, return Date first verified call commit. Defaults FALSE. branch Optional character scalar. Ref check searching. NULL empty, function uses origin/HEAD available, otherwise HEAD. max_commits Maximum number candidate commits verify (order). Use cap runtime large histories. Defaults Inf (cap). cache_dir Directory used cache cloned repositories. Defaults getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "gh_repo_cache")). dir Directory within repo search. Defaults "R".

title: Find the first commit where a function is called in a GitHub repo — get_first_call_github
text: call found: date_only = TRUE, Date. Otherwise, one-row data.frame columns: owner, repo, fname, first_call, author, message, url, file. found (repository searched), returns NA date_only = TRUE, otherwise NULL.

title: Find the first commit where a function is called in a GitHub repo — get_first_call_github
text: Unlike functions track latest state, function concerned historical "firsts". Therefore, cached clone already exists, network fetch performed. cached repository assumed contain complete history. cached clone detected shallow invalid, deleted recloned ensure correctness. return value either commit date (date_only = TRUE) one-row data.frame commit metadata GitHub URL. function emits diagnostic message() output determine answer (e.g., repository found/inaccessible, checkout failed, git errors) fname never called dir. Candidate commits obtained git log --reverse -G <regex> dir, using patterns match fname calls like: fname[[:space:]]*\\( ::fname[[:space:]]*\\( candidate validated searching repository tree commit git grep -E call-like pattern. function shares -disk Git clone cache get_first_commit() via ggext.git_cache option. Repositories cloned either function reused . best performance across sessions, set persistent cache location:

what: Find the first commit that introduces a function definition in a GitHub repo — get_first_commit
title: Find the first commit that introduces a function definition in a GitHub repo — get_first_commit
text: Clones (refreshes) GitHub repository local cache directory, checks target ref (branch default), scans commits (oldest newest) touch occurrences function_name R/. candidate commit, verifies function actually defined (assigned via <- =) somewhere tree commit using git grep.

title: Find the first commit that introduces a function definition in a GitHub repo — get_first_commit
code: get_first_commit(   owner,   repo,   function_name,   date_only = FALSE,   pattern = NULL,   branch = NULL,   max_commits = Inf,   cache_dir = getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "gh_repo_cache")) )

title: Find the first commit that introduces a function definition in a GitHub repo — get_first_commit
text: owner Character scalar. GitHub username/organization. repo Character scalar. GitHub repository name. function_name Character scalar. Symbol search (e.g. "geom_foo"). date_only Logical; TRUE, return Date first verified defining commit. Defaults FALSE. pattern Optional character regex intended verification. NULL, defaults PCRE pattern approximating assignment function_name. Note: argument currently used implementation (verification done via git grep -E internally constructed ERE). branch Optional character scalar. Ref check searching. NULL/empty, function uses origin/HEAD available, otherwise HEAD. max_commits Maximum number candidate commits verify (order). Use cap runtime large histories. Defaults Inf (cap). cache_dir Directory used cache cloned repositories. Defaults getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "gh_repo_cache")).

title: Find the first commit that introduces a function definition in a GitHub repo — get_first_commit
text: defining commit found: date_only = TRUE, Date. Otherwise, one-row data.frame columns: package, fname, first_commit, author, message, url, file. found (repo searched), returns NA date_only = TRUE, otherwise NULL.

title: Find the first commit that introduces a function definition in a GitHub repo — get_first_commit
text: return value either commit date (date_only = TRUE) one-row data.frame commit metadata GitHub URL. function emits diagnostic message() output determine answer (e.g., repository found/inaccessible, checkout failed, git log/grep errors) symbol never defined R/. Candidate commits obtained : git log --reverse -S <function_name> <ref> -- R searches commits literal string function_name appears diffs R/ (additions removals). candidate validated searching repository tree commit git grep assignment-like pattern foo <- foo =. local cached clone corrupted fetch fails, cache directory repo deleted recloned. best performance across sessions, set persistent cache location:

title: Find the first commit that introduces a function definition in a GitHub repo — get_first_commit
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Return full metadata for first defining commit of "geom_ridgeline" x <- get_first_commit("wilkelab", "ggridges", "geom_ridgeline")  # Date only d <- get_first_commit("tidyverse", "ggplot2", "geom_point", date_only = TRUE)  # Limit verification work x2 <- get_first_commit("someorg", "somerepo", "foo", max_commits = 200) } # }

what: Find the first CRAN release exporting a symbol — get_first_export_cran
title: Find the first CRAN release exporting a symbol — get_first_export_cran
text: function identifies earliest version package CRAN explicitly exports given symbol NAMESPACE via export(). intentionally ignores exportPattern() avoid false positives.

title: Find the first CRAN release exporting a symbol — get_first_export_cran
code: get_first_export_cran(   package,   fname,   date_only = FALSE,   repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org",   cache_dir = getOption("ggext.cran_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "cran_export_cache")) )

title: Find the first CRAN release exporting a symbol — get_first_export_cran
text: package Character. name CRAN package (e.g. "ggplot2"). fname Character. symbol search (e.g. "geom_point"). date_only Logical. TRUE, return publication Date. Defaults FALSE. repos Character. CRAN mirror URL. Defaults "https://cloud.r-project.org". cache_dir Character. Directory used cache parsed CRAN metadata. Defaults getOption("ggext.cran_cache"), falling back temporary directory.

title: Find the first CRAN release exporting a symbol — get_first_export_cran
text: date_only = TRUE, Date object NA. Otherwise, one-row data.frame columns: package: package name fname: function name version: CRAN version symbol first exported first_cran: CRAN publication date (may NA older releases) is_reexport: logical indicating whether symbol imported via importFrom() (.e., re-export) Returns NULL symbol never exported.

title: Find the first CRAN release exporting a symbol — get_first_export_cran
text: Re-exports detected checking corresponding importFrom() directive symbol. Results cached per package per version avoid repeatedly downloading parsing CRAN tarballs.

what: Find the first commit where a symbol is explicitly exported on GitHub — get_first_export_github
title: Find the first commit where a symbol is explicitly exported on GitHub — get_first_export_github
text: Identifies earliest Git commit given symbol becomes explicitly exported repository file (default, package NAMESPACE). function clones repository locally () cache directory searches local Git history export directives.

title: Find the first commit where a symbol is explicitly exported on GitHub — get_first_export_github
code: get_first_export_github(   owner,   repo,   fname,   date_only = FALSE,   branch = NULL,   cache_dir = getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "gh_repo_cache")),   file = "NAMESPACE" )

title: Find the first commit where a symbol is explicitly exported on GitHub — get_first_export_github
text: owner Character. GitHub account name (e.g. "tidyverse"). repo Character. GitHub repository name (e.g. "ggplot2"). fname Character. Symbol/function name search (e.g. "geom_point"). date_only Logical. TRUE, return commit date Date. FALSE (default), return one-row data.frame commit metadata. branch Character. Optional ref check searching (branch, tag, commit-ish). NULL, uses origin/HEAD available; otherwise uses HEAD. cache_dir Character. Directory used cache cloned repositories. Defaults getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(),"gh_repo_cache")). file Character. Path (within repo) file search. Defaults "NAMESPACE".

title: Find the first commit where a symbol is explicitly exported on GitHub — get_first_export_github
text: date_only = TRUE, Date (.Date(NA) failure). Otherwise one-row data.frame columns: package, fname, first_gh, author, message, url, file; NULL failure.

title: Find the first commit where a symbol is explicitly exported on GitHub — get_first_export_github
text: initial clone, operations local use GitHub API. avoids rate limits allows function work without Wi-Fi long repository already cloned cache. search looks explicit forms: export(fname) export("fname") export('fname') Notes: detects explicit exports . interpret exportPattern() semantics. history search uses git log -S target file (default: NAMESPACE); file never existed chosen ref, function returns NULL (.Date(NA) date_only = TRUE). fetch/pull performed. remote repository updates, must delete cached clone refresh .

title: Find the first commit where a symbol is explicitly exported on GitHub — get_first_export_github
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Earliest explicit export date (requires git; clones once, then local) get_first_export_github("tidyverse", "ggplot2", "geom_point", date_only = TRUE)  # Full commit metadata get_first_export_github("tidyverse", "ggplot2", "geom_point")  # Search a different ref or file get_first_export_github("tidyverse", "ggplot2", "geom_point", branch = "main") get_first_export_github("someowner", "somerepo", "foo", file = "path/to/NAMESPACE") } # }

what: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
text: Determines whether package currently CRAN, CRAN archive, neither location, returns earliest known release date.

title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
code: get_first_release(   pkg,   cran_package_db = NULL,   archive_df = NULL,   date_only = FALSE )

title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
text: pkg Character scalar. Package name. cran_package_db data frame returned tools::CRAN_package_db(). archive_df data frame columns package archive_date, typically created build_archive_df(). date_only Logical. TRUE, return release date scalar.

title: Get CRAN location and first release date for an R package — get_first_release
text: date_only = FALSE (default), one-row data frame columns: package first_release date_only = TRUE, single Date (NA).

what: Find the first (root) commit in a GitHub repository — get_first_repo_commit
title: Find the first (root) commit in a GitHub repository — get_first_repo_commit
text: Clones (refreshes) GitHub repository shared local cache determines earliest (root) commit using git history, without relying GitHub REST API.

title: Find the first (root) commit in a GitHub repository — get_first_repo_commit
code: get_first_repo_commit(   owner,   repo,   branch = NULL,   date_only = FALSE,   cache_dir = getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "gh_repo_cache")) )

title: Find the first (root) commit in a GitHub repository — get_first_repo_commit
text: owner Character scalar. GitHub username organization. repo Character scalar. GitHub repository name. branch Optional character scalar. Git ref use (e.g. "main"). NULL empty, function uses origin/HEAD available, otherwise HEAD. date_only Logical. TRUE, return Date first commit. Defaults FALSE. cache_dir Directory used cache cloned repositories. Defaults getOption("ggext.git_cache", file.path(tempdir(), "gh_repo_cache")).

title: Find the first (root) commit in a GitHub repository — get_first_repo_commit
text: root commit found: date_only = TRUE, Date. Otherwise, one-row data.frame columns: first_repo, author, message, url. repository accessed inspected: Returns NA date_only = TRUE Returns NULL otherwise

title: Find the first (root) commit in a GitHub repository — get_first_repo_commit
text: function uses -disk Git repository cache related helpers: get_first_commit() get_first_export() get_first_call_github() cache location controlled ggext.git_cache option. Repositories cloned refreshed functions reused across calls, avoiding redundant network access.

title: Find the first (root) commit in a GitHub repository — get_first_repo_commit
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ get_first_repo_commit("YuLab-SMU", "ggtree") get_first_repo_commit("tidyverse", "ggplot2", date_only = TRUE)  options(ggext.git_cache = "~/Library/Caches/ggext_git") } # }

what: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
text: Transforms GitHub Pages URLs form https://<user>.github.io/<repo>/ corresponding GitHub repository URLs: https://github.com/<user>/<repo>.

title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
text: url character vector URLs. element may GitHub Pages URL URL.

title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
text: character vector URLs length url. GitHub Pages URLs converted GitHub repository URLs; URLs returned -.

title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
text: Non–GitHub Pages URLs returned unchanged. function detects GitHub Pages URLs using pattern https://<user>.github.io/<repo>/. user-level Pages URLs include repository path converted. Root Pages URLs https://<user>.github.io/ left unchanged, map unambiguously single repository.

title: Convert GitHub Pages URLs to GitHub repository URLs — github_pages_to_repo
